$description: Template for creating SPAR Engine validation scenarios. Copy this file and modify the fields below.
name: Your Scenario Name Here
description: Detailed description of what this scenario validates or tests. Include purpose, expected outcomes, and any special considerations.

_comments.schema_version: Format version for future compatibility. Current: 1.0
_comments.name: Display name for the scenario (used in UI and reports)
_comments.output_basename: Clean filename base for results (e.g., 'phase_validation_normal'). If omitted, auto-generated from name.
_comments.presets: Array of environment presets to test. Options: dungeon, city, wilderness, ruins
_comments.phases: Array of scene phases to test. Options: approach, engage, aftermath
_comments.rarity_modes: Array of rarity modes to test. Options: calm, normal, spiky
_comments.batch_size: Number of events to generate per preset/phase/mode combination
_comments.base_seed: Base RNG seed. Each run gets base_seed + run_index for reproducibility
_comments.include_tags: CSV of tags to require (empty = no filter). Useful for focused testing
_comments.exclude_tags: CSV of tags to exclude (empty = no filter). Useful for isolation testing
_comments.tick_between: Whether to tick state between events (true recommended for long batches)
_comments.ticks_between: Number of ticks between events when tick_between=true
_comments.verbose: Include full event lists in output (false recommended for large batches)

comprehensive_validation.name: Full Phase Coverage Test
comprehensive_validation.description: Tests all combinations for complete coverage analysis

spiky_mode_stress_test.name: Spiky Mode Cutoff Analysis
spiky_mode_stress_test.description: Validates cutoff frequency targets in Spiky mode
